name: Dumbbell Bent Over Row
description: Hold your dumbbells at your sides and hinge at the hips until your chest is parallel to the floor, dumbbells hanging below your knees (picture 1). Keeping your elbows close to your body, row both dumbbells towards your hips (oicture 2). Squeeze your shoulder blades down and together and lower under control to the start before repeating. Avoid using momentum from your torso and focus on squeezing your back, hard.

name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
description: Sit on bench. Grasp dumbbell between feet. Place back of upper arm to inner thigh. Lean into leg to raise elbow slightly.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
description: Grab your dumbbells and lay flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground (use a bench if you have one). Press the weights up, locking out your elbows (A). Lower them slowly until your upper arms are resting on the floor (B) close to your body. Pause here before explosively pressing back up. Squeeze your chest hard and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Squat
description:
Grasp dumbbell with both hands at the sides of the upper plates. Hold dumbbell in front of chest, close to torso. Place feet about shoulderwide apart, keep knees slightly bent.
Squat down until thighs are parallel to floor. Keep back straight, bend and move hips backward to keep knees above feet. Return, keep knees slightly flexed. Repeat.
Keep bodyweight on heels and look ahead or slightly above to keep back straight.

name: Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans
description: On your feet, stand tall with your dumbbells, holding them at your sides. Hinge at the hips to lower them to your knees (picture 1). Stand back up with a slight jump, using the momentum to pull the dumbbells up on to your shoulders (picture 2). Stand up straight, then lower under control to your sides and repeat. Keep this fast and explosive; if your heart rate doesn’t hit the roof, you’re doing them wrong.

name: Dumbbell Incline Curl
description: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

name: Dumbbell Lunges Walking
description: Take two dumbbells in your hands, stand straight, feet about shoulder wide. Take one long step so that the front knee is approximately forming a right angle. The back leg is streched, the knee is low but doesn't touch the ground. "Complete" the step by standing up and repeat the movement with the other leg.

name: Dumbbell Push-Up
description: Normal Push-ups on Dumbbells, this brings a further range of movement

name: Dumbbell Single-leg Hip Thrust
description:
The single-leg hip thrust is performed by placing your upper back on a weight bench, raising one leg, and extending the hip of the other leg to achieve an isolated contraction of the glute.

By working each side separately, you can fully isolate your glutes unilaterally, providing maximal training stimulus.

name: Dumbbell Triceps Extension
description:
Position one dumbbell over head with both hands under inner plate (heart shaped grip).
With elbows over head, lower forearm behind upper arm by flexing elbows. Flex wrists at bottom to avoid hitting dumbbell on back of neck. Raise dumbbell over head by extending elbows while hyperextending wrists. Return and repeat.

name: Dumbbell bicep curl to press
description:
Bend your elbows and lift the dumbbells to your shoulders.

Push the dumbbells over your head while rotating your arms to make your palms face forward. Reverse it to lower down. Repeat the exercise.

name: Dumbbell close grip bench press
description:
Lie down with your back on a flat bench. Hold a dumbbell in each hand. Raise your arms towards the ceiling with your palms facing each other and dumbbells pressed together.

Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, then slowly push them back. Repeat the exercise.

name: Dumbbell drag curls
description: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward. Pull your elbows back and lift the dumbbells to your chest height. Slowly lower the dumbbell and repeat the exercise.

name: Dumbbell farmers carry
description: Grab half your body weight in each hand and walk.

name: Dumbbell rear delt row
description: Hold a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at your hips to make your back almost parallel to the floor. Let your arms hang down. Keep your arms in line with your shoulders. bend and lift your elbows out to the sides until your upper arms are parallel to the floor. Slowly return and repeat

name: Dumbbell sumo deadlift
description: Lower your dumbbell to the ground between your legs. Assume a wide stance and with a straight back squat down. With the dumbbell standing upright, grip it by the top of the ‘head’ (picture 1).b /bKeeping your chest up and core braced, push the floor away, driving back upwards to a standing position (picture 2). Repeat. If you can easily achieve 20-30 reps, use two dumbbells.

name: Dumbbell upright-row
description: Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your body. Keep your palms towards your body. Lift you hands straight up until your hands are under your chin, then lower them. Repeat the exercise.

name: Dumbbell wide bicep curls
description:
Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and palms facing forward.

Bend your elbows and lift the dumbbells to your shoulders. Slowly return and repeat.

name: Sitting on the wall
description: l li Line on the wall to look forward, the feet are firmly placed on the ground, shoulder wide opened and about 60 cm away from the wall, but the legs up the wall until the legs upright angle and slide down the wall.The knees should be directly on the ankles, the pain of the pain is normal, if you feel pain on the knee or knee cap

name: Dynamic side hold
description: Sling a rubber band on a kettlebell and lift the kettlebell by the rubber band. Let it hang by your side and stand on one leg, switch leg while continuing hold. Repeat with other hand

name: Squat

name: EZ-Bar Skullcrusher - NB
description: The EZ-bar skullcrusher is a popular exercise targeting the triceps muscles. The EZ-bar is used more often than a straight bar. As for the name, that’s worst-case scenario. The bar should actually come down behind the head. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps as part of an upper body or arms-focused workout. No need to chase a 1RM on this move!

name: One -legged squats on the right
description: Ol li stand on one leg, the other leg is straight and slightly forward./Li li slowly go out of the crouch, stretch the bent knee and hold the other leg straight.

name: Knee elevations
description: The elevation of legs at 90 ° in the bar is a very intense exercise in which all abdominal muscles intervene.

name: Frontal elevations
description:
To execute the exercise, the lifter stands with the feet separated to the width of the shoulders and weights or resistance mangoes are sustained to the sides with a grip in pronation (above the head).

The movement consists of carrying the arms in front of the body at the height of the eyes and with only a slight flexion of the elbow.This isolates the anterior deltoid muscle (in front of the shoulder) and uses the anterior deltoid to lift the weight.

When lifting it is important to keep the body motionless so that the anterior deltoid is completely used;If the weight cannot be lifted while still, then it is too heavy and a lower weight is needed.It is important to maintain a slight flexion in the elbow when lifting, since keeping the elbow will add tension to the elbow joint and could cause injuries.

You can also use a neutral grip, similar to the one used in the hammer curl.With this variation, the weight rises again to the eye level, but at an angle of 45 degrees from the front of the body.This can be beneficial for people with shoulder injuries, particularly those related to the sleeve of the rotators.

name: Elliptical
description: It improves muscle toning, strengthens the leg muscles (quads, glutes, calves), helps vascularisation and increases resistance. The elliptical is also very useful if you aim to lose weight.

Get your head in the extension of the back, facing the ground.The feet must be spread about the width of the hips.   stages:  l li Move a knee to the center of your body, to your elbows, keeping theAnother tense leg. /li li In a quick jump movement, straighten the folded leg and pull the other knee to your body. /li li Repeat step 2 alternating the legs. /li /li  Note:   Throughout the exercise, your back must remain as straight as possible - avoid having a hump or a hoist back. / p

name: Yoga Exercise: cow-gatto
description: Start by taking the four -foot position.The hands are under the shoulders.The fingers are open to fan and ensure a stable position.It is better to rest the front weight of the body on the thumbs and indexes.Now place the legs to the width of the hips on the yoga mat.The thighs must be vertically under the sides.Make sure the weight is distributed evenly in your hands and knees.The head is an extension of the spine and the gaze is turned towards the mat.The back is in a neutral position.Inhale deeply and start with the cat.With the next exhalation, round the vertebra back for vertebra.Try to pull yourself as much as possible towards the ceiling.Pull your head towards the chest and tilt the pelvis.Now inhale deeply and move on to the opposite position, that of the cow.Fold your back down, pull your shoulders lightly back and lift your head as much as it is comfortable.The gaze is facing up.Exhale consciously and go back to the cat's position.With the next exhalation, go back to the cow.Repeat the exercise a few times and make sure you are in the flow

name: Extension of triceps with barbell
description:
Place the barbell at the top with a narrow socket.
Lower the forearm behind the upper arm keeping the elbows up.Extend the forearm over the head.Lower and repeat.

name: Exercise Band Dorsiflexion
description: This exercise uses an exercise band. It targets the Soleus and Tibialis anterior.

name: Exercise Band Plantarflexion
description: Banded plantarflexion is a great way to bridge the gap between plantarflexion range of motion and the more strenuous calf raises in weight bearing. This can help strengthen the calf muscles, load the Achilles tendon, and improve plantarflexion range of motion.

name: Hip extensions

name: Triceps extension

name: Parachutist in T-position
description: Lay on your stomach, your legs are more than shoulder width spread, your feet set up.Your arms are stretched out and form a T with your upper body, your palms lie on the floor.Now lift your upper body with the arms and your legs as far as you can.Turn your thumb towards the ceiling and pull your shoulder blades together.While you hold the upper body and all limbs in the air, bring your legs together and then spread it again, you keep it steadily in the air.With the further repetitions you only move your legs open.

name: Finger Pushup
description:
1. Hand Positioning:
- Start in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders.
- Spread your fingers wide apart, placing them firmly on the ground.

2. Finger Placement:
- Gradually lift your palms off the ground, shifting the weight onto your fingers.
- Focus on distributing the load evenly across your fingertips and thumbs.

3. Body Alignment:
- Maintain a straight line from head to heels to engage your core.
- Keep your body in a controlled and stable position throughout the exercise.

4. Lowering Phase:
- Slowly bend your elbows, lowering your chest towards the ground.
- Ensure controlled movement, maintaining stability on your fingertips.

5. Pushing Up:
- Press through your fingertips to straighten your arms, returning to the starting position.
- Emphasize the engagement of your fingers and thumbs throughout the push-up.

You can reach this position by walking with your hands back from a high board.to the side, keeping your back and legs straight and moving your head closer to the floor.Li Repeat. /li /LL

name: Fist flexion with bar
description:
Sitting on a bench, take a bar with your palms facing up and your hands apart on the width of your shoulders.Rest your forearms on your thighs and let your wrists hang over your knees.Run the movement by bowing your palms and wrists toward your face.

Take a break for a moment in the upper position and then slowly return the bar to the starting position.

name: Push ups
description: Home position:   Enter the starting position of flexion, with your hands and fingers touching the floor and back, arms and legs straight.To reach this position, you can lie on your stomach, put your hands turned down at the head and lift your arms until you are straight.Fold the elbows until your chest almost touches the floor, making sure your back are always straight. /li li Use your arms to return to the starting position.Li /LO

His body must be straight and pointed slightly forward.Your arms should be extended.Do not get up using impulse, such as kicking. /li li carefully lower the body back to the starting position. /li li Repeat.P ul li To do push-ups correctly, you must first increase strength in several key areas, including shoulders, arms and abdominal.Start with push -ups only after building enough strength with other exercises. /li /ul

name: Flying KH flat bench
description: reach two dumbbells and put yourself on a bench and stretch your arms completely.Feet, back and head lie firmly on the floor/bench and give hold.Now lightly bend your arms on the elbow joint and let it down with a semicircular movement.Without changing this angle, it brings it up again.

name: Flying KG incline bench
description: reach two dumbbells and place yourself on a slanted bench and completely stretch out your arms.Feet, back and head lie firmly on the floor/bench and give hold.Now lightly bend your arms on the elbow joint and let it down with a semicircular movement.Without changing this angle, it brings it up again.

name: Floor dips
description: Starting position:Sit with your arms behind you, supporting your back.Your fingers should point forward.Your knees should be bent, feet together.Steps:olliRaise your hips off the ground, straightening your arms./liliBend your elbows, bringing your hips down./liliStraighten your arms, returning to the previous position./liliRepeat steps 2 and 3./li/olNotes:The exercise's difficulty depends on how high you bring your hips.

name: Fly With Dumbbells
description: Take two dumbbells and lay on a bench, make sure the feet are firmly on the ground and your back is not arched, but has good contact with the bench. The arms are stretched in front of you, about shoulder wide. Bend now the arms a bit and let them down with a half-circle movement to the side. Without changing the angle of the elbow bring them in a fluid movement back up.

name: Fly With Dumbbells, Decline Bench
description:
The exercise is the same as with a regular bench:
Take two dumbbells and lay on a bench, make sure the feet are firmly on the ground and your back is not arched, but has good contact with the bench. The arms are stretched in front of you, about shoulder wide. Bend now the arms a bit and let them down with a half-circle movement to the side. Without changing the angle of the elbow bring them in a fluid movement back up.

name: Forward arm circles

name: Forward shoulder rotation

name: French press
description: French Press French Press with dumbbells above the head

name: French Press KG
description:
take the dumbbells in your hand, lie down on a bench and stand so that approx. 1/4 of the head is no longer on the bench.Extend your arms and now let the weights down with one sheet.When the dumbbells are just over the forehead, press them up again. 
 It is important to move the elbows little throughout the exercise so that the triceps do the work.

name: Frenchpress SZ-Stange
description:
take the dumbbell, lie down on a bench and stand so that about 1/4 of the head is no longer on the bench.Extend your arms and now let the weight down with one sheet.When the pole is just over your forehead, press it up again. 
 It is important to move the elbows little throughout the exercise so that the triceps do the work.

name: Frog stand
description:
Starting position:

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward, facing a wall or bench for support if needed.
Bend your knees into a squat position.
Place your hands on the ground in front of you, shoulder-width apart, with your fingers spread wide.
Make sure your elbows are under your shoulders and your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels.
Upward phase:

Push with your feet and hands to lift your body off the ground.
Straighten your legs and arms, keeping your body aligned.
Engage your core and glutes to maintain the position.
If needed, rest your knees on the wall or bench for assistance.

name: Front squat
description:
P With this variant of the squat, the leg biceps and the large buttock muscle are trained. 
 In addition, the back extensors and the abductors are used.

name: Front Lever
description: The front lever is a figure where the body is kept in a horizontal position parallel to the floor.

name: Front Plank
description:
The plank is a bodyweight exercise. As a multi-functional movement, the plank not only targets your abdominal muscles but also the spine and hip. Plank strengthens and tightens your entire body, improves your posture and balance, reduces body fat, and can help boost your metabolism.
Exercises such as the “plank pose” help strengthen the stamina of stabilizing abdominal muscles. It can also help relieve back pain associated with a weakening of the function of the stabilizing muscles of the body.
Planks are a versatile exercise that targets many of the most important muscle groups in the body, so they can be applied by anyone to improve endurance and overall body strength.

name: Front Pull narrow
description: Unavailable

name: Front Raises
description:
To execute the exercise, the lifter stands with their feet shoulder width apart and weights or resistance handles held by their side with a pronated (overhand) grip.
The movement is to bring the arms up in front of the body to eye level and with only a slight bend in the elbow. This isolates the anterior deltoid muscle (front of the shoulder) and uses the anterior deltoid to lift the weight.
When lifting it is important to keep the body still so the anterior deltoid is fully utilised; if the weight cannot be lifted by standing still then it is too heavy and a lower weight is needed. It is important to keep a slight bend in the elbow when lifting as keeping the elbow locked will add stress to the elbow joint and could cause injury.
A neutral grip, similar to that used in the hammer curl, can also be used. With this variation the weight is again raised to eye level, but out to a 45 degree angle from the front of the body. This may be beneficial for those with shoulder injuries, particularly those related to the rotator cuff.

name: Front Squats
description: Squats

name: Front lever
description: The front lever is a figure where the body is maintained in a horizontal parallel position to the floor.

name: Front lever pull-up
description: in the front lever position, with legs extended or easier if collected, pull by bringing the chest closer to the bar.

name: Front lever tuck
description: The muscles involved in the front lever, more subjected to effort, are mainly & nbsp; the extensors such as: the great backbone, the large roundabout, the rear deltoid and the biceps of the biceps

If you feel the need for support, clasp your hands behind your head./liliVery slowly close and open your mouth./liliAt the end, slowly return to starting position and close mouth./li/ol

name: Full Sit Outs
description: (A) Get in high plank position on your hands and toes.(B) Shift your weight to your left hand as you turn your body to the right; bend your right leg behind you and extend your right arm up. Return to the center and repeat on the opposite side. Continue, alternating sides.strongMake it easier:/strong Don’t raise your arm after you bend your leg behind you.strongMake it harder:/strong Balance with your arm and leg extended for two counts.

name: Full Sit Outs
description: (a) stand on your hands and toes in a high plank position.(B) shift your weight to your left hand as you turn your body to the right.Bend your right leg behind and stretch your right arm up.Return to the middle and repeat this on the other side.Go away with alternating pages.Make it easier: don't lift your arm after you have bent your leg behind.Make it more difficult: keep your arm and leg stretched for two counts.

name: Push up
description: Una flexión de brazos es un ejercicio de calistenia que consiste en levantar y bajar el cuerpo con los brazos. Se utilizan comúnmente para desarrollar la fuerza de la parte superior del cuerpo, mejorar la estabilidad central y mejorar la condición física general. Las flexiones se pueden realizar prácticamente en cualquier lugar y no requieren equipo especial, lo que las convierte en un ejercicio conveniente para hacer ejercicio en casa o cuando no tienes acceso a un gimnasio.

name: Circle of neck clockwise
description: P starting position:   start sitting or standing.Lower your head down and bring your chin to the chest, but do not press.   Steps:   Exercise in a slow, flowing movement, your headis relaxed and does not press in any direction:  l li lean towards your right shoulder. /li li Then put your head back and look up. /li Li Then lean towards the left shoulder /li li and back into the starting position. /li /l  Repeat this as part of a slow, flowing movement.

reach two dumbbells, the palms show the body.Bend the arms and brig the dumbbells with a quick movement upwards, in contrast to the normal KH curls strong not /strong by 90 degrees, so the palms show the inside all the time.Without a break, the weight is now brought down in a controlled manner.Note that the movement is faster than down. 
P During the movement sequence, the body must not swing in.The elbows always stay in the place.

name: Hammercurls
description:
Hold two dumbbells and sit on a bench with a straight back, the shoulders are slightly rolled backwards. Your pals point to your body. Bend the arms and bring the weight up with a fast movement. Don't rotate your hands, as with the curls. Without any pause bring the dumbbell down with a slow, controlled movement.
Don't swing your body during the exercise, the biceps should do all the work here. The elbows are at your side and don't move.

name: Handstand Pushup
description: The handstand push-up (press-up) - also called the vertical push-up (press-up) or the inverted push-up (press-up) also called commandos- is a type of push-up exercise where the body is positioned in a handstand. For a true handstand, the exercise is performed free-standing, held in the air. To prepare the strength until one has built adequate balance, the feet are often placed against a wall, held by a partner, or secured in some other way from falling. Handstand pushups require significant strength, as well as balance and control if performed free-standing.

name: Head turns

You can reach this position by leading your hands back from a high plank stand.  To the side, keep back and legs straight and bring your head closer to the floor. /li li Extend your arms, press the hip back and hold back and legs straight. /lili Repeat the process. /li /ol

name: Helms Row
description:
Setup: Place your chest on the end of a bench, using a towel or anything soft to keep your chest protected. You want your chest to be in contact with the bench around the nipple line. Your back should be almost parallel to the floor

Execution: When you’re starting the exercise, focus on pulling your elbows back until you feel maximum tightness in the lats.

If you want to get some trap activation with the exercise, relax your shoulder blades when the weights are hanging down and then retract them as you start the rep.

name: High knees

name: High plank

name: Hip Raise, Lying
description: Lying down on your back, with your feet flat on the floor. Raise your hips up evenly as high as you can and hold for as long as you can.

name: Hip Thrust
description: The bar should go directly on your upper thigh, directly below your crotch. Your feet should be directly under your knees. Push your hips up so that you form a straight line from your knees to your shoulders. Use a pad for comfort.

Steps:  l li Keep the starting position for the whole durationof the exercise. /li /l

name: Incline Bench Reverse Fly - Hello
description: The incline dumbbell reverse fly is an upper-body exercise targeting the posterior or rear deltoids, as well as the postural muscles of the upper back. Because it targets such small muscles, this exercise is usually performed with light weight for high reps, such as 10-15 reps per set or more.

name: Incline Chest-Supported Dumbbell Row
description:
Set up an adjustable bench at a 45-degree angle.
Lay on your stomach with your head hanging just above the edge of the bench.
Grab a dumbbell in each hand and set up with a good posture – core and lats engaged and shoulders neutral.
Row the dumbbells toward the top of the stomach and squeeze the back at the top of the rep.
Finally, lower the dumbbells back to the starting position and repeat until all reps are completed.

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
description: The incline dumbbell press is a mixture of the dumbbell chest press and the shoulder press, and both the front deltoids and the upper portions of the chest muscles are worked in this exercise

name: Incline Dumbbell Fly
description: Use inclined bench. Hold dumbbells straight out to your sides, elbows slightly bent. Bring arms together above you, keeping angle of elbows fixed.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
description: The incline dumbbell press is a mixture of the dumbbell chest press and the shoulder press, and both the front deltoids and the upper portions of the chest muscles are worked in this exercise.

name: Incline Dumbbell Row
description:
ol
liUsing a neutral grip, lean into an incline bench./li
liTake a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip, beginning with the arms straight. This will be your starting position./li
liRetract the shoulder blades and flex the elbows to row the dumbbells to your side./li
liPause at the top of the motion, and then return to the starting position./li
/ol

name: Inverted Rows
description:
Maintain a straight body, retract your shoulder blades, and pull your 
chest to the bar for an effective back and upper body workout.

name: Investidas
description: olliFique de pé com as costas retas/liliDê um grande passo adiante com sua perna esquerda/liliDesça com sua pélvis até quase tocar o chão com o seu joelho direito/liliLeve sua pélvis de volta para cima/liliRetorne para a posição de pé, dando um passo atrás/liliRepita, trocando de pernas a cada vez/li/ol

name: Iperestensioni Lombari
description: Hyperextensions, also known as back extensions or reverse crunches, are exercises that target the muscles of the lower back, specifically the erector spinae. Here's how to perform hyperextensions correctly:olliLie facedown on a hyperextension bench or a stability ball, positioning your hips at the edge and securing your ankles under the foot pads or having a partner hold them./liliPlace your hands behind your head, crossing your arms at the wrists or resting them on your chest./liliEngage your core muscles by drawing your belly button toward your spine./liliSlowly lift your upper body off the bench or ball, focusing on using your lower back muscles to initiate the movement. Keep your neck in a neutral position./liliContinue lifting until your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels./liliPause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the motion./liliRepeat for the desired number of repetitions, usually 8 to 12./li/ol

name: Lumbar hyperextensions
description: Le iperestensioni lombari, note anche come estensioni del dorso o crunch inversi, sono esercizi che mirano ai muscoli della parte bassa della schiena, in particolare l'erettore spinale. Ecco come eseguire correttamente le iperestensioni lombari:olliSdraiati a pancia in giù su una panca per iperestensioni o su una palla da ginnastica, posizionando i fianchi sul bordo e fissando le caviglie sotto i supporti per i piedi o facendole tenere da un partner./liliMetti le mani dietro la testa, incrociando le braccia sui polsi o appoggiandole sul petto./liliContrai i muscoli addominali tirando il tuo ombelico verso la colonna vertebrale./liliSolleva lentamente la parte superiore del corpo dalla panca o dalla palla, concentrandoti sull'uso dei muscoli della parte bassa della schiena per iniziare il movimento. Mantieni il collo in posizione neutra./liliContinua a sollevarti finché il tuo corpo forma una linea retta dalla testa ai talloni./liliBrevemente fai una pausa nella posizione più alta del movimento, quindi abbassa lentamente la parte superiore del corpo fino alla posizione di partenza, mantenendo il controllo durante tutto il movimento./liliRipeti per il numero desiderato di ripetizioni, di solito da 8 a 12./li/ol

name: Isometric Wipers
description:
Assume push-up position, with hands slightly wider than shoulder width.
Shift body weight as far as possible to one side, allowing the elbow on that side to flex. 
Reverse the motion, moving completely over to the other side.
Return to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Isometric Wipers
description:
Nehmen Sie die Liegestütze-Position ein, wobei die Hände etwas breiter als die Schulterbreite sind.
 
Das Körpergewicht so weit wie möglich zur Seite verlagern, damit sich der Ellbogen auf dieser Seite beugen kann.
 
Kehren Sie die Bewegung um und bewegen Sie sich vollständig auf die andere Seite.
 
Kehren Sie in die Ausgangsposition zurück und wiederholen Sie den Vorgang für die gewünschte Anzahl von Wiederholungen.

name: JM Press
description: The JM press keeps your shoulders stationary, relying on the elbow flexion and extension to move the weight using your triceps strength. That means you get all the benefits of the best triceps-strengthening exercises without overtaxing that delicate shoulder joint. Classic win-win!

name: Joelhos para cima
description: olliCorra no lugar, colocando os joelhos o mais alto o confortável e trocando de pernas a um ritmo rápido/li/ol

name: Jongkok

name: Jongkok menyodorkan
description: Posisi awal:Mulailah dengan posisi papan tinggi:punggung, lengan, dan kaki lurus dan tangan selebar bahu.Langkah:olliLompati kaki Anda ke depan di antara kedua lengan, jaga punggung tetap rata./liliMenjaga tangan Anda di lantai, melompat kaki Anda kembali ke posisi papan tinggi./liliUlangi./li/ol

name: Jump rope: basic jumps
description: Starting position:Put your feet close together, bend the knees a bit, keep your head and body straight, keep elbows in, open your arms.Steps:olliSpin only your wrists with enough force to make the rope spin./liliJump just high enough to pass the rope below your feet./liliRepeat./li/olNotes:This exercise requires a jump rope. Make sure the rope length is adjusted to your height. One way to check is to grab both handles with one hand and stand on the middle of the rope hanging on the ground with one foot. If the rope (excluding the handles) reaches just below your chest, its length is right. A shorter rope would be hazardous, as you might hit yourself, and a longer rope would make for bad form.

name: KH an Scottmaschine
description: Setze dich vor der Scottmaschine, stelle die Höhe so ein, dass die Achselhöhlen auf die Oberkante liegen. Die Oberarme liegen parallel auf der Fläche und bleiben während der Übung auch so. Ziehe die Hanteln so weit wie möglich hoch und bringe sie ohne Pause wieder runter. Strecke dabei die Arme ganz aus.

name: Keine Liegestütz-Burpees
description: Ausgangsposition:Gerade stehen, Füße hüftbreit auseinander.Schritte:olliGehen Sie in die Hocke und stützen Sie sich mit den Händen zwischen den Knien und vor den Füßen mit geradem Rücken auf dem Boden ab./liliLassen Sie die Hände auf dem Boden und springen Sie mit den Beinen nach hinten in eine hohe Plank-Position./liliSpringen Sie mit den Füßen nach vorne, um wieder in die Hocke zu gehen./liliSpringen Sie hoch./liliWiederholen Sie dies./li/ol

name: Kettlebell Deadliften
description: Beginpositie:Ga op heupbreedte uit elkaar staan, met je kettlebell gecentreerd tussen je enkels. Je rug moet recht zijn, je hoofd naar voren gericht.Stappen:olliScharnier bij de heupen en buig lichtjes bij de knieën om je handen op de kettlebell handgrepen te plaatsen. Je rug moet recht zijn terwijl je de beweging uitvoert./liliPak de kettlebell handgrepen vast, waarbij je handen in tegengestelde richtingen duwen alsof je de handgreep uit elkaar trekt./liliTerwijl u contact maakt met uw buikspieren en bilspieren, gaat u rechtop staan./liliScharnier weer bij de heupen om de kettlebell weer naar beneden te brengen, op dezelfde manier als bij stap 1./liliHerhaal vanaf stap 3./li/olTips:ulliZorg ervoor dat je de bewegingen correct uitvoert, want als je dat anders doet kan dat tot blessures leiden. Bijvoorbeeld, niet squatten in plaats van scharnieren bij de heupen, niet je rug rond maken terwijl je naar de kettlebell reikt, en niet achterover leunen terwijl je opstaat./li/ul

name: Kettlebell Deadlifts
description: Posizione di partenza:Stare alla larghezza delle anche, con il kettlebell centrato tra le caviglie. La schiena deve essere dritta, la testa rivolta in avanti.Passi:olliInclinarsi sui fianchi e piegare leggermente le ginocchia per mettere le mani sulle maniglie del kettlebell. La schiena deve essere dritta mentre si esegue il movimento./liliAfferrare le maniglie del kettlebell, con le mani che spingono in direzioni opposte come se si volesse separare la maniglia./liliMentre contattate gli addominali e i glutei, alzatevi in piedi./liliInclinarsi di nuovo sui fianchi per riportare il kettlebell verso il basso, in modo simile al passo 1./liliRipetere dal punto 3./li/olSuggerimenti:ulliAssicuratevi di eseguire i movimenti correttamente, perché altrimenti potreste farvi male. Per esempio, non accovacciarsi invece di piegarsi sui fianchi, non arrotondare la schiena mentre si raggiunge il kettlebell, e non piegarsi all'indietro mentre ci si alza./li/ul

name: Kettlebell Kreuzheben
description: Ausgangsposition:Stellen Sie sich hüftbreit auseinander, die Kettlebell befindet sich in der Mitte zwischen Ihren Knöcheln. Der Rücken sollte gerade sein, der Kopf nach vorne zeigen.Schritte:olliBeugen Sie sich in der Hüfte und gehen Sie leicht in die Knie, um die Hände auf die Kettlebell-Griffe zu legen. Der Rücken sollte gerade sein, während Sie die Bewegung ausführen./liliGreifen Sie die Kettlebell-Griffe und drücken Sie mit den Händen in entgegengesetzte Richtungen, als ob Sie die Griffe auseinanderziehen wollten./liliWährend Sie Ihre Bauch- und Gesäßmuskeln anspannen, richten Sie sich auf./liliBeugen Sie sich wieder in die Hüfte, um die Kettlebell wieder nach unten zu bringen, ähnlich wie in Schritt 1./liliWiederholen Sie den Vorgang ab Schritt 3./li/olTipps:ulliAchten Sie darauf, dass Sie die Bewegungen korrekt ausführen, da dies sonst zu Verletzungen führen kann. Gehen Sie z.B. nicht in die Hocke statt in die Hüfte, machen Sie den Rücken nicht rund, wenn Sie nach der Kettlebell greifen, und lehnen Sie sich beim Aufstehen nicht zurück./li/ul

name: Kettlebell Swings
description:
Hold the kettlebell securely in both hands. Keep your back flat throughout the move, avoiding any rounding of the spine.Keeping your knees "soft", hinge your hips backwards, letting the kettlebell swing between your knees.
You want to bend from the hips as far as you can emwithout letting your back round forwards/em. Then, snap your hips forwards quickly and standing up straight, locking your body in an upright posture.
The speed you do this will cause your arms and the kettlebell to swing up in front of you. Don't try to emlift/em the kettlebell with your arms. The snapping forwards of your hips will cause the kettlebell to swing forwards through momentum. Depending on the weight of the kettlebell and the speed of your hip movement, your arms will swing up to about shoulder height. At the top of this swing, let your hips hinge backwards again as the kettlebell swings back down to between your legs and the start of the next repetition.

name: Kettlebell Swings
description:
Hold firmly the kettlebell with both hands.Keep your back for the whole movement, avoiding any rounding of the spine.Keeping the knees "soft", it tilted the hips backwards, letting the kettlebell oscillates between the knees.

You want to bend from the sides as much as possible without making your back run forward.Then, quickly trigger your hips forward and stand up, blocking your body in an upright posture.

The speed with which you do it will make your arms oscillate and the kettlebell in front of you.Don't try to lift the kettlebell with your arms.The forward shot of the hips will swing the kettlebell forward through the momentum.Depending on the weight of the kettlebell and the speed of the hip movement, your arms will oscillate approaching the height of the shoulders.In the upper part of this swing, let your hips bend backwards again while the kettlebell oscillates again between your legs and the beginning of the next repetition.

name: Kettlebell deadlifts
description: Starting position:Stand hip-width apart, with your kettlebell centered between your ankles. Your back should be straight, your head facing forward.Steps:olliHinge at the hips and slightly bend at the knees to put your hands on the kettlebell handles. Your back should be straight as you perform the movement./liliGrab the kettlebell handles, with your hands pushing in opposite directions as if to pull the handle apart./liliWhile contacting your abs and glutes, stand straight up./liliHinge at the hips again to bring the kettlebell back down, similarly to step 1./liliRepeat from step 3./li/olTips:ulliBe sure you're performing the movements correctly, as doing otherwise can lead to injury. For example, do not squat instead of hinging at the hips, do not round your back while reaching for the kettlebell, and do not lean back while standing up./li/ul

name: Kettlebell swing
description: Le oscillazioni con kettlebell sono un allenamento per tutto il corpo, colpiscono principalmente i muscoli lungo la catena posteriore (parte posteriore del corpo). I principali muscoli utilizzati sono i glutei, i muscoli posteriori della coscia, gli erettori spinali e i muscoli della parte superiore della schiena.

name: Kettlebell swing a una mano
description: Come un normale swing con kettelbell, solo con un braccio. Gambe divaricate alla larghezza delle spalle, inizia con il kettelbell tra le gambe e fallo oscillare davanti a te mentre allunghi le gambe, quindi riportalo indietro tra le gambe.

name: Kick-Backs
description: Stelle dich auf einer Bank, wie beim einarmigen KH-rudern: ein Knie und eine Hand auf die Bank, das andere Bein ist auf dem Boden und gibt Halt. Nehme die KH, der Vorderarm macht einen rechten Winkel und zeigt nach unten. Ohne die Ellenbogen zu bewegen, bringe das Gewicht hoch.

name: Kickbacks berlutut
description: olliMerangkak turun./liliDorong satu kaki ke belakang hingga diperluas, konsentrasi pada otot gluteus./liliTunggu sebentar, kemudian kembali ke posisi awal./liliUlangi, alternating feet/li/ol

name: Kickbacky v kleku
description: olliDolů na všech čtyřech./liliZatlačte jednu nohu zpět až do úplného prodloužení a soustřeďte se na gluteusové svaly./liliZůstaňte jednu sekundu a pak se vraťte do výchozí polohy./liliOpakujte, střídavé nohy/li/ol

name: Kin instoppen
description: Beginpositie:Zit of sta met rechte rug.Stappen:olliGebruik uw vingers op uw kin om uw kin langzaam in te trekken, beweeg uw hoofd naar achteren om het op één lijn te brengen met uw ruggengraat./liliHoud 5 seconden vast./liliol start="3"liGa terug naar de normale hoofdpositie en herhaal./li/ol/li/ol

name: Kinderpose
description: Ausgangsposition:Beginnen Sie auf allen Vieren, wobei Knie, Zehen und Hände den Boden berühren. Ihre beiden großen Zehen sollten sich berühren.Schritte:olliBewegen Sie Ihre Knie so, dass sie etwa hüftbreit auseinander sind./liliBewegen Sie beim Ausatmen Ihr Becken nach hinten, so dass Sie auf Ihren Fersen sitzen. Ihre Hände sollten noch den Boden berühren./liliEntspannen Sie Ihren Oberkörper, indem Sie die Stirn auf den Boden senken und die Hände ganz natürlich nach vorne bewegen./liliBleiben Sie in dieser Haltung./li/olTipps:ulliUm die Haltung zu verlassen, führen Sie die Arme wieder unter die Schultern und bringen Sie den Oberkörper in eine sitzende Position./li/ul

name: Kindhouding
description: Beginpositie:Begin op handen en voeten, knieën, tenen en handen raken de grond. Je twee grote tenen moeten elkaar raken.Stappen:olliBeweeg je knieën zo dat ze op heupbreedte uit elkaar staan./liliOp een uitademing, beweeg je bekken naar achteren om op je hielen te zitten. Je handen moeten nog steeds de grond raken./liliol start="3"liOntspan uw bovenlichaam, laat uw voorhoofd naar de grond zakken en laat uw handen op een natuurlijke manier naar voren bewegen./li/ol/liliBlijf in deze houding./li/olTips:ulliOm de houding te verlaten, loop je armen terug onder je schouders en beweeg je bovenlichaam omhoog in een zittende positie./li/ul

name: Kliky
description: Výchozí poloha:Zaujměte výchozí polohu kliku, s dlaněmi a prsty na nohou dotýkajícími se země a rovnými zády, pažemi a nohama. Pro dosažení této pozice si můžete lehnout na břicho, dlaně položit na zem vedle hlavy, a postupně se rukama zvednout, dokud nebudou rovné.Kroky:olliOhněte postupně lokty dokud se vaše hruď nedotkne země. Vaše záda by měla být rovná během celého pohybu./liliZvedněte se pažemi zpět do výchozí polohy./liliOpakujte od začátku./li/ol

name: Kliky s rotací
description: olliProveďte standardní push-up:/li/ol1.Lehněte si na břicho1.b položte ruce blízko uší1.c pomocí paží zvedněte žaludek nahoru, dokud nejsou paže rovné, držte záda rovně1.d ohněte paže, dokud se hrudník téměř nedotkne země, ujistěte se, že záda je rovná1.e zvedněte žaludek znovu a vraťte se ke kroku 3ol start="2"liOtočte tělo na stranu tak, aby záda byla rovná, spodní ruka podporující tělo je plně prodloužena a pouze spodní ruka a noha se dotýkají podlahy/liliOpakujte, pokaždé měňte strany v kroku 2/li/ol

name: Kliky ve střeše
description: Výchozí pozice:Střecha:Tělo ve tvaru písmene V – rovná záda, paže a nohy, boky ve vzduchu.Do této pozice se dostanete tak, že z vysokého prkna postupně popojdete rukami k tělu.Kroky:olliPokrčte lokty do stran, záda a nohy držte rovné a hlavu přibližte k podlaze./liliNarovnejte paže, boky pohněte zpět nahoru a záda a nohy mějte stále rovné./liliOpakujte./li/ol

name: Klimmzug an Leiste
description: Klimmzüge an einer gewählten Leiste eines Fingerboards / Hangboards

name: Klimmzüge
description: Greife die Klimmzugstange mit breitem Griff, der Körper hängt zunächst frei nach unten. Ziehe nun die Brust raus und bringe den Körper nach oben, bis dein Kinn über der Stange liegt (oder der Nacken sie berührt, wenn du emnach hinten/em gezogen hast), gehe nun langsam nach unten und wiederhole.

name: Kneeling kickbacks
description: Starting position:Get down on all fours.Steps:olliPush one foot back until fully extended, concentrating on the gluteus muscles./liliStay for one second, then return to the initial position./liliRepeat, alternating feet./li/ol

name: Knie hoch
description: olliAuf der Stelle laufen, dabei die Knie so hoch wie möglich ansetzen und die Beine in schnellem Tempo wechseln./li/ol

name: Kniebeuge
description:
Stelle die Halterung der Langhantel auf so eine Höhe ein, dass du sie bequem raus- und wieder reinbringen kannst. Bereite dich vor:
ul
lidie Stange ist etwas tiefer als Schulterhöhe/li
lidie Füße sind ziemlich auseinander und zeigen leicht nach außen/li
lider Kopf ist im Nacken und schaut nach vorne/oben./li
lidie Brust wird nach außen gebracht/li
/ul
Gehe nun langsam runter, bis der Oberschenkel einen rechten Winkel bildet, nicht tiefer. Die Knie zeigen leicht nach außen, dein Gesäß nach hinten. Mache eine kleine Pause und gehe mit so viel Energie wie du aufbringen kannst, wieder nach oben. Nach 2 Sekunden Pause gehe wieder runter.

name: Kniebeugen
description: Ausgangsposition:Beginne in der hohen Plank-Position:Rücken, Arme und Beine sind gestreckt, die Hände sind schulterbreit auseinander.Schritte:olliSpringe mit den Füßen zwischen den Armen nach vorne und halte den Rücken flach./liliLasse die Hände auf dem Boden und springe mit den Beinen zurück in die hohe Plank-Position./liliWiederhole die Übung./li/ol

name: Kniende Rückschläge
description: Ausgangsposition:Gehen Sie auf alle Viere.Schritte:olliDrücken Sie einen Fuß nach hinten, bis er ganz gestreckt ist, und konzentrieren Sie sich dabei auf die Gesäßmuskeln./liliVerweilen Sie eine Sekunde lang und kehren Sie dann in die Ausgangsposition zurück./liliWiederholen Sie den Vorgang, indem Sie die Füße abwechseln./li/ol

name: Kolları çevirme
description: l li Stand upright so that your back is flat.= "2" li Continue to turn your arms as described in the step.

name: Konzentrations-Curls
description: Setz dich auf die Bank. Fassen Sie die Hantel zwischen den Beinen. Legen Sie den Oberarm an den inneren Oberschenkel. Unterarm anheben.

name: Kopf drehen
description: Ausgangsposition:Sitzen oder stehen Sie mit geradem Rücken und Schultern nach unten.Schritte:olliSetzen oder stellen Sie sich gerade hin, die Schultern sind gesenkt./liliDrehen Sie Ihren Kopf so weit wie möglich zur Seite. Halten Sie an, wenn Sie auf ein Hindernis stoßen, und bleiben Sie 5 Sekunden lang stehen./liliKehren Sie in die Mittelposition zurück und wiederholen Sie den Vorgang, wobei Sie die Seite wechseln./li/ol

name: Kopf neigen
description: Ausgangsposition:Sitzen oder stehen Sie mit geradem Rücken.Schritte:olliNeigen Sie den Kopf zu einer Seite und halten Sie ihn ein wenig./liliBringen Sie den Kopf in die neutrale Position zurück und halten Sie ihn kurz./liliNeigen Sie den Kopf auf die andere Seite und halten Sie ihn kurz./liliBringen Sie den Kopf wieder in die neutrale Position und halten Sie ihn ein wenig./liliWiederholen Sie die Übung./li/ol

name: Kreuzheben
description:
Stelle dich mit etwas mehr als schulterbreitem Stand vor der Stange, die Füße zeigen leicht nach außen, die Stange ist direkt darüber und sehr nahe am Schienbein. Beuge die Knie (zeigen ebenfalls etwas nach außen) und neige den Oberkörper (bleibt während der ganzen Übung gerade). Greife die Stange schulterbreit mit einem Unter- und einem Obergriff.
Ziehe nun die Stange nach oben. An der höchsten Stelle mache ein leichtes Hohlkreuz und drücke die Schultern nach hinten. Gehe wieder runter, wobei du darauf achtest, dass der Rücken gerade bleibt und sich nicht krümmt. Du kannst unten angekommen eine kleine Pause einlegen oder sofort weitermachen.

name: Kroužení pažemi dopředu
description: olliPostavte se zpříma s rovnými zády./liliDejte paže před tělo, posuňte je dolů, za záda, nad hlavu a zpět do výchozí polohy./liliPokračujte v kroužení pažemi dle popisu v kroku 2./li/ol

name: Kroužení pažemi dozadu
description: olliPostavte se zpříma s rovnými zády./liliDejte paže před tělo, zvedněte je nad hlavu a pak pokračujte v pohybu za záda a dolů do výchozí polohy./liliPokračujte v kroužení pažemi dle popisu v kroku 2./li/ol

name: La testa gira
description: Posizione di partenza:Seduti o in piedi con la schiena dritta e le spalle abbassate.Passi:olliSedersi o stare in piedi con la schiena dritta e le spalle abbassate./liliGira la testa di lato il più possibile. Fermati quando colpisci una barriera e tieni premuto per 5 secondi./liliRitorna in posizione centrale e ripeti, cambiando lato./li/ol

name: Lagartijas
description: olliAcuéstese boca abajo./liliPonga sus manos cerca de sus orejas./liliUsa los brazos para levantar el estómago hasta que los brazos estén rectos, manteniendo la espalda recta/liliDoble los brazos hasta que el pecho casi toque el suelo, asegurándose de que la espalda esté recta./liliRepita desde el paso 3/li/ol

name: Landmine-Press, Einarmig
description:
Diese Übung kann wahlweise im parallelen oder versetzten Stand durchgeführt werden.
Greife das Ende einer Langhantel, während das andere Ende fixiert am Boden ist und versuche das Gewicht von dir wegzudrücken ohne dabei die Langhantel Richtung Körpermittelpunkt zu bewegen. Der ganze Körper bleibt während der Übungsausführung gerade und angespannt.

name: Lantai dips
description: Posisi awal:Duduklah dengan tangan di belakang Anda, dukung punggung Anda.Jari-jari Anda harus mengarah ke depan.Lutut Anda harus ditekuk, kaki menyatu.Langkah:olliAngkat pinggul Anda dari tanah, luruskan lengan Anda./liliTekuk siku Anda, turunkan pinggul Anda./liliLuruskan lengan Anda, kembali ke posisi sebelumnya./liliUlangi Langkah 2 dan 3./li/olCatatan:Kesulitan latihan tergantung pada seberapa tinggi Anda membawa pinggul Anda.

name: Lateral Raises
description: This exercise works the deltoid muscle of the shoulder. The movement starts with the arms straight, and the hands holding weights at the sides or in front of the body. Body is in a slight forward-leaning position with hips and knees bent a little. Arms are kept straight or slightly bent, and raised through an arc of movement in the coronal plane that terminates when the hands are at approximately shoulder height. Weights are lowered to the starting position, completing one rep. When using a cable machine the individual stands with the coronal plane in line with the pulley, which is at or near the ground.[9] The exercise can be completed one shoulder at a time (with the other hand used to stabilize the body against the weight moved), or with both hands simultaneously if two parallel pulleys are available.

name: Lateral-to-Front Raises
description:
-(1) Perform a lateral raise, pausing at the top of the lift (2).
-Instead of lowering the weight, bring it to the front of your body so that you appear to be at the top position of a front raise.  You will do this by using a Pec Fly motion, maintaining straight arms. (3)
-Now lower the weight to your quadriceps, or, in other words, lower the dumbbells as though you are completing a Front Raise repetition. (4)
-Reverse the motion:  Perform a front raise (5), at the apex of the lift use a Reverse Fly motion to position the weights at the top of a Lateral Raise (6), and finally, lower the weights until your palms are essentially touching the sides of your thighs (7).  THIS IS ONE REP.
(1) l  emfront view  /em(2) -l- em FV  /em  (3) l-  emside view/em   (4) l  emSV/FV/em   (5) l-  emSV  /em (6) -l-  emFV  /em  (7)  l  emFV/SV/em

name: Left levator scapulae stretch
description: Starting position:Start standing up or sitting down. Turn your head to the left, around 45 degrees or just above your nipple. Place your right hand behind your back or sit on it. Take your left hand and use it to hold the back of your head. Lean your head down slightly.Steps:olliAfter assuming the starting position, press your head against your left hand with slight force. Your hand should press back with equal force, so that your head doesn't move. Hold this position./li/ol

name: Left neck stretch
description: Starting position:Sit or stand with your back straight.Steps:olliTilt your head to the side./liliTake the hand closer to your head and use it to grab your head from the other side./liliPush with your hand against your head and with your head against your hand so that the forces balance out and your head stays still./liliMaintain this tension until the end of the exercise./li/ol

name: Leg Raises, Lying
description: Lay down on a bench and hold onto the recliner with your hands to keep you stable. Hold your legs straight and lift them till they make an angle of about 45°. Make a short pause of 1 sec. and go slowly down to the initial position. To increase the intensity you can make a longer pause of 7 sec. every 5th time.

name: Leg raises pull up bar
description: with a firm grip with both hands on the bar, raise your outstretched legs, until you reach a 90° angle with your torso.

name: Levantamento terra
description:
Fique firme, com os pés ligeiramente mais afastados do que os ombros. Fique diretamente atrás da barra, onde ela mal deve tocar sua canela, com os pés apontando um pouco para fora. Curve-se com as costas retas, os joelhos também apontando um pouco para fora. Agarre a barra com uma pegada na largura dos ombros, uma pegada por baixo e uma pegada reversa.

Puxe o peso para cima. No ponto mais alto, faça uma leve depressão para trás e puxe a barra para trás. Segure 1 ou 2 segundos nessa posição. Desça, certificando-se de que as costas não estão dobradas. Depois de descer, você pode voltar assim que os pesos tocarem o chão ou fazer uma pausa, dependendo do peso.

name: Levantamento terra com Kettlebell
description: Posição inicial:Fique em pé na largura do quadril, com o kettlebell centralizado entre os tornozelos. Suas costas devem estar retas, sua cabeça voltada para a frente.Passos:olliDobre os quadris e dobre levemente os joelhos para colocar as mãos nas alças do kettlebell. Suas costas devem estar retas enquanto você executa o movimento./liliAgarre as alças do kettlebell, com as mãos empurrando em direções opostas, como se fosse separar a alça./liliEnquanto faz contato com seus abdominais e glúteos, fique em pé./liliDobre os quadris novamente para trazer o kettlebell de volta para baixo, semelhante ao passo 1./liliRepita a partir da etapa 3./li/olDicas:ulliCertifique-se de realizar os movimentos corretamente, pois fazer o contrário pode causar lesões. Por exemplo, não se agache em vez de dobrar os quadris, não arredonde as costas ao alcançar o kettlebell e não se incline para trás ao se levantar./li/ul

name: Lever du mollet droit
description: l li Stand on the ground or on the edge of a walk to increase the amplitude of the movements.Raise a foot by placing the upper part on your calf /li li Lift your heels until you are standing on the toes /li li Stay in this position for three seconds, then lower yourfoot without touching the floor with your heel. /li / ol

name: Liegestütz
description:
P Output position of the push -up is the prone position, the body is stretched.The hands are located a little over shoulder width on the ground.The fingers point forward, their thumb inwards.By tensioning the arms at the same time, these are stretched and the upper body lifts off the ground.The weight is distributed evenly on tips of the toe and hands.The head, neck, spine, buttocks and knees form a line and the abdominal muscles are tense.Now both arms are bent at the same time and the upper body is lowered until the tip of the nose almost touches the floor.The body remains stretched. 
ul
li The head must be in a line with the body when the push -up, the view is directed at the floor. /li
li The head must not be taken on the neck, otherwise there is a risk. /li
li The butt should not hang down or be stretched far up.Hollow cross formation is avoided by body tension. /li
li In order to fully train the chest muscles, the exercise must be carried out with the greatest possible radius of movement.The training effect is more intense, the deeper the upper body is brought to the ground. /li
li do not carry out steady movements. /li
li The arms are not completely stretched out but remain slightly bent in the highest position to keep the tension in the chest, shoulders and triceps constant. /li
li Exhale when you are in the highest perpetrators, inhale when sinking. /li
/ul

name: Liegestütz-Drehungen
description: P starting position:   go to the starting position for pushups, whereby hands and toes touch the floor and the arms and legs are straight.To achieve this position, you can lay on your stomach, put your hands down next to your head and raise your arms up until they are. li Create a normal push -up: /li /l  1.a bend your arms until the breast almost touches the floor, and make sure that the back is straight.1.b Reacge back into the starting position with your arms.  Ol Start = "2" li Turn your body to the side so that the back is straight, the lower hand that supports the body, completely stretched and only the lower hand and the foot touch the floor. /li li Repeat the process, changing the page every time.

name: Liegestüzten Diamond
description: Liegestütze mit Händen zusammen. Die Hände werden so nebeneinander gelegt, das Daumen und Zeigefinger eine Raute (Diamant) bilden

name: Lingkaran lengan ke depan
description: LO li Stand up straight with your back straight. /li li Bring your arms forward, lift above your head, then continue the movement behind your back and to the initial position. /li liCircle your hands as described in step 2. /li /l

name: Lingkaran lengan mundur
description: olliBerdiri tegak dengan punggung lurus./liliJaga agar lengan tetap lurus, bawa di depan Anda, angkat di atas kepala, lalu lanjutkan gerakan di belakang punggung dan turun ke posisi awal./liliTerus lingkari lengan Anda seperti yang dijelaskan pada Langkah 2./li/ol

name: Linke Nackendehnung
description: starting position:   Sit or stand with a straight back.li Take the hand that is closer to the head and grasp your head from the other side. /li li Press your hand against your hand and head against your hand so thatCompensate for the forces and the head remains calm. /li li keep this tension up to the end of the exercise.

description: Starting position:   Sit or stand with straight back.   Steps:  OL li Tilt your head to the side and hold 8 seconds to be stuck tostretch the side of your neck. /li li Get softly with the nearest hand on top of your head to stretch further.Hold for 8 seconds. /li li Turn your chin to your shoulder.Hold for 8 seconds. /li li Let go and return to the starting position. /li /l

name: Links planken
description: OL li Lie on your left side, hold your right elbow straight and stick out your arm. /li li Push your pelvis up by lifting your right shoulder, but keep your upper arm on the floor - your head, pelvis and feet must be in a straight line. /li li Hold this position VAS /li /l

name: Lompat tali: basic Jump
description: This exercise requires a rope to jump.Make sure the string length is adjusted to your height.One way to check it is to grab the two handles with one hand and place in the center of the rope hanging from the ground with one foot.If the rope (excluding the handles) reaches you just below the chest, its length is adequate.A shorter rope would be dangerous, since you could hit you, and a longer rope would be a bad shape., keep your elbows inside, open your arms.. /li li Repeat from step 2. /li /te

name: Low Box Squat - Wide Stance
description: Unrack the bar and set your stance wide, beyond your hips.  Push your hips back and sit down to a box that takes you below parallel.  Sit completely down, do not touch and go.  Then explosively stand up.  Stay tight in your upper back and torso throughout the movement.

name: Lunge hareketi

name: Reverse lunge
description: Home position:   Stand straight, with your feet away.so you can comfortably bend at an angle of 90 degrees. /li li Slowly double both knees to form 90 degrees angles. /li li Return to the starting position. li Repeat, alternating the legs. /li /l

name: Lunges
description: Starting position:Stand with back straight.Steps:olliTake a large step forward with your left leg./liliBring your pelvis down until you almost touch the floor with your right knee./liliBring your pelvis back up./liliReturn to the starting position by stepping back./liliRepeat, switching legs each time./li/ol

name: High knees
description: olliRun in place, put knees as high as is comfortable and switching legs at a quick pace/li/ol

name: Lying Rotator Cuff Exercise
description:
This is an excercise for problems with the levator muscles. Primary  Infraspinatus, secondary Teres Minor.
Lying on side. Keep elbow on waist and in 90 dgr angle. Rotate towards stomach. Add weight as fit.

name: Marches
description: li li Stand standing in front of a chair /li li climb on the chair /li li Descend the chair /li li Repeat /li /noclol

name: Meadows Row
description: The Meadows row is a unilateral row performed with a landmine setup, overhand grip, and staggered stance. Lean your torso forward and grip the barbell. Rest the other forearm on the forward leg. Start this movement by driving the elbow behind you while retracting the shoulder-blade. Keep the working shoulder down. Pull toward your back hip until the elbow is level with your torso.

name: Half squats right
description: O li Stand with your back straight /li li From a long step forward with your left leg /li li Lower the pelvis until you almost touch the floor with the right knee li li Go up the pelvis /li li Repeat from step 3. /li /te

name: Half left squat

name: Soil dive
description: Posição inicial:Sente-se com seus braços atrás de você, apoiando suas costas.Seus dedos devem apontar para frente.Seus joelhos devem estar dobrados, com os pés juntos.Passos:olliLevante seus quadris do chão, endireitando seus braços./liliDobre os cotovelos, abaixando os quadris./liliEndireite os braços, voltando à posição anterior./liliRepita os passos 2 e 3./li/olNotas:A dificuldade do exercício depende do quanto você eleva seus quadris.

name: Military Press Mit sz-Bar
description: On an SZ-bar grip your hands on the outside of each bend and stand with your arms straight down, palms facing your legs. Pull the bar (bending your arms at the elbow) to your chest, and the push the bar above your head (arms as straight as possible). Return the bar to your chest by dropping your arms at the elbows. Return the bar to it's origional position (stand with your arms straight down, palms facing your legs.)

name: Mountaineers
description: Posição inicial:Começar na posição vertical de flexão, ou na prancha alta.As mãos devem estar diretamente abaixo dos seus ombros.Manter a cabeça alinhada com as costas, virada para o chão.Os pés devem ter a distância entre os quadris.Passos:olliMova um joelho em direção ao centro do corpo, em direção aos cotovelos, mantendo a outra perna estendida./liliNum movimento de salto rápido, endireite a perna dobrada para fora e puxe o outro joelho em direção ao seu corpo./liliContinue a repetir o passo 2, alternando as pernas./li/olNotas:Ao longo do exercício, as costas devem permanecer o mais reto o possível - evite uma corcunda ou uma curvatura nas costas.

name: Mountaineers
description: Posición inicial:Comienza en la posición de flexión vertical o plancha alta.Las manos deben estar directamente debajo de los hombros.Mantenga la cabeza alineada con la espalda, mirando al suelo.Los pies deben estar separados a la anchura de las caderas.Pasos:olliMueve una rodilla hacia el centro del cuerpo, hacia los codos, manteniendo la otra pierna extendida./liliCon un movimiento rápido de salto, estira la pierna doblada y tira de la otra rodilla hacia tu cuerpo./liliSigue repitiendo el paso 2, alternando las piernas./li/olNotas:Durante todo el ejercicio, la espalda debe permanecer lo más recta posible, evitando una joroba o una espalda flácida.

name: Mountaineering

name: Mountain climbers
description: Starting position:Start in the upright push-up position, aka. the high plank position.Hands should be directly under your shoulders.Keep your head in line with your back, facing the floor.Feet should be about hip-width apart.Steps:olliMove one knee toward the center of your body, towards your elbows, keeping the other leg extended./liliIn a quick jumping movement, straighten the bent leg out and pull the other knee toward your body./liliKeep repeating step 2, alternating legs./li/olNotes:Throughout the exercise, your back should remain as straight as possible – avoid a hump or a sagging back.

name: Muscle up
description:
The body is then explosively pulled up by the arms in a radial pull-up, with greater speed than a regular pull-up. When the bar approaches the upper chest, the wrists are swiftly flexed to bring the forearms above the bar. The body is leaned forward, and the elbows are straightened by activating the triceps. The routine is considered complete when the bar is at the level of the waist and the arms are fully straight.
To dismount, the arms are bent at the elbow, and the body is lowered to the floor, and the exercise can be repeated.
As a relatively advanced exercise, muscle-ups are typically first learned with an assistive kip. The legs swing (kip) up and provide momentum to assist in the explosive upward force needed to ascend above the bar. More advanced athletes can perform a strict variation of the muscle-up which is done slowly, without any kip. This variation begins with a still dead hang and uses isometric muscle contraction to ascend above the bar in a slow, controlled fashion.

name: Muscle up
description: The body is then pulled on explosively from the arms in a radial pull-up, with a greater speed than a normal pull-up.When the bar approaches the top of the chest, the wrists are quickly flexed to bring the forearms over the bar.The body is inclined forward and the elbows are straightened by activating the triceps.The routine is considered complete when the bar is up to life and the arms are completely straight.To go down, the arms are folded at the elbow, the body is lowered to the ground and the exercise can be repeated.Being a relatively advanced exercise, muscle-ups are generally learned for the first time with a assisted kip.The legs oscillate (kip) upwards and provide momentum to attend the explosive force in the upper explosive force to climb over the bar.The most advanced athletes can perform a rigorous variation of the muscle-up that is performed slowly, without any kip.This variation begins with a immobile suspension and uses isometric muscle contraction to climb the bar in a slow and controlled way.

name: Dynamic side board
description: La planche latérale dynamique implique de se placer sur le côté, en appui sur un coude et le côté du pied, puis de basculer les hanches de haut en bas tout en maintenant une ligne droite du corps.

name: Dynamic board
description:
1.	Commencez en position de planche, avec vos mains directement sous vos épaules et vos pieds écartés à la largeur des hanches.
2.	Contractez vos abdominaux pour maintenir votre corps en ligne droite de la tête aux pieds.
3.	À partir de cette position, pliez légèrement les genoux et sautez avec les deux pieds vers l'intérieur, en les rapprochant de votre tronc autant que possible.
4.	Dès que vos pieds touchent le sol, poussez avec force pour sauter à nouveau et revenir à la position de planche initiale.
5.	Continuez à répéter ce mouvement de saut, en gardant le contrôle et en maintenant la stabilité de votre tronc tout au long de l'exercice.
6.	Assurez-vous de garder une respiration régulière pendant que vous sautez, en respirant profondément et en contrôlant votre respiration.
7.	Gardez votre regard fixé sur le sol pour maintenir un bon alignement de la colonne vertébrale.
8.	Répétez les sauts pendant la durée souhaitée ou selon le nombre de répétitions recommandé pour votre programme d'entraînement.
9.	Pour terminer l'exercice, reposez-vous en relâchant la position de planche, puis étirez-vous si nécessaire pour détendre vos muscles.

Keep your body always straight and keep this position as long as possible.To increase the difficulty, it is possible to raise an arm or leg during the execution of this exercise.

name: Plate twist
description:
Step 1: Sit on an exercise mat with your legs extended in front of you.
Step 2: Grasp a plate in both hands as if holding a steering wheel, arms slightly bent, and hold it in front of your abdominals.
Step 3: With knees slightly bent, cross your ankles and slowly lift them a few inches off the floor.
Step 4: Keep your back straight but lean backward slightly to help maintain balance.
Step 5: Exhaling, rotate your torso (twist) to the right side and touch the end of the plate to the floor.
Step 6: Inhale and return to the forward facing start position.
Step 7: Exhaling, rotate your torso (twist) to the left side and touch the end of the plate to the floor.
Step 8: Inhale and return to the forward facing start position.
Step 9: Repeat for a full set.

name: Press Banking Sitting
description: Put the chest press machine so that when you sit down the grips are aligned with the bottom of the chest.Make sure you are sitting with your back well stuck to the seat.Grab a handle with each hand, take your chest out, keep your head against the headrest.Breathe deeply and slowly push the handles forward until your arms are almost completely extended.Pause just before the blockade, and then slowly return the handles to the initial position.Pause just before the handles stop completely and perform another repetition

Breathe deeply and slowly push the handles forward until your arms are almost completely extended.Pause just before the blockade, and then slowly return the handles to the initial position.Pause just before the handles stop completely and perform another repetition.

name: Prisoner Squat
Prisoner Squat
description: Stand upright with a slightly raised chest, your feet are hip width apart, the toes are pointing forward.Take your hands with slightly entangled fingers on the back of the head, the elbows point to the side.Slide your hip back and bend your knees, the upper body remains as upright as possible.Press your knees outwards, they must never show each other.If your upper body moves slightly forward, make sure that it does not bend.Always keep the elbows at the level of the ears by tensing the muscles between your shoulder blades.If you are flexible enough, you can sink down until your buttocks touch your calves.But make sure that you don't bend your spine.Before that happens, you turn the movement and press out of your heels and gluts muscles with so much swing up that your feet briefly lift off and you make a small hop.If necessary, correct the position of the feet, arms and upper body before you connect the next repetition.

name: Push Up
description: A push-up is a calisthenic exercise that involves lifting and lowering your body using your arms. They are commonly used to build upper body strength, improve core stability, and enhance overall physical fitness. Push-ups can be performed virtually anywhere and require no special equipment, making them a convenient exercise for home workouts or when you don’t have access to a gym.

name: Push Ups
description: Start with your body streched, your hands are shoulder-wide appart on the ground. Push yourself off the ground till you strech your arms. The back is always straight and as well as the neck (always look to the ground). Lower yourself to the initial position and repeat.

name: Push-Ups
description: Push-ups are an exercise in which a person, keeping a prone position, with the hands palms down under the shoulders, the balls of the feet on the ground, and the back straight, pushes the body up and lets it down by an alternate straightening and bending of the arms.

name: Push-Ups | Decline
description:
Decline push-ups are another modified version of the traditional push-up that target the upper body muscles in a different way. To perform a decline push-up, elevate your feet on an elevated surface, such as a bench, chair, or step, while placing your hands on the ground in a push-up position. Lower your body towards the ground while maintaining a straight line from your shoulders to your ankles, and then push back up to the starting position.

Unlike the inclined push-up, the decline push-up places more emphasis on the shoulders and triceps, while still engaging the chest muscles to a lesser extent. By elevating your feet, you increase the difficulty of the exercise by placing more weight on your upper body, forcing your shoulders and triceps to work harder to push your body back up. The decline push-up can be a great way to challenge your upper body strength and improve your ability to perform other push-up variations. As with any exercise, be sure to use proper form and start with a height that is appropriate for your strength and fitness level.

name: Push-Ups | Incline
description: Inclined push-ups primarily target the chest muscles (pectoralis major and minor), but also work the triceps, shoulders, and core to a lesser extent. Because the upper body is elevated, the incline push-up places less emphasis on the triceps compared to regular push-ups, which may be beneficial for individuals looking to specifically target their chest muscles.

name: Push-up
description: Initial position:   Entering the position of the initial push-up, with hands and feet touching the ground and back, arms and legs straight.To reach this position, you can lie on your stomach, put your hands facing down to the head, and raise your hands up straight.Almost touching the floor, make sure your back is always straight. /li li Use your arm to lift yourself back to the initial position. /li li Repeat.

name: Push-up rotations
description: Starting position:Get into the starting push-up position, with your hands and toes touching the ground and back, arms and legs straight. To get to this position, you can lie down on your stomach, place your hands facing down next to your head, and lifting your arms up until they are straight.Steps:olliPerform a standard push-up:/li/ol1.a Bend arms until chest almost touches the ground, making sure the back is straight.1.b Use your arms to lift yourself back up to starting position.ol start="2"liRotate your body to the side so that the back is straight, the bottom hand supporting the body is fully extended, and only the bottom hand and foot touch the floor./liliRepeat, changing sides at step 2 each time./li/ol

You can reach this position by moving your hands back from the high board.   Steps:   1. bend the elbows to the side, keep your back and feet straight andMove your head closer to the floor.  ol start = "2" li Straighten your arms, push your hips up and keep your back straight. /li li Repeat. /li /ol

name: Turn head
description: initial position:   sit or stand with a straight back and shoulder down.. /li li Turn your head to the side as far as possible.Stop when you press the barrier and hold for 5 seconds. /li li Return to the middle position and repeat, change the side. /li

name: Sitting with a support with a support
description: When exercising the arm, hold in place, do not raise them up, in contraction pull the blades together and down, the upper arm along the body backwards.Concentrate on your back muscles and not on your hand muscles.

name: Quadruped Arm and Leg Raise
description:
In this exercise, the back muscles and the muscles of the back of the leg and back of the arm are activated by lifting the crossed arm and leg at the same time in the crawling position. It also improves balance and proprioception. The movement is done symmetrically.

1. Get into a crawling posture.2. Draw your abdomen in, then raise your right leg and left arm.3. You should keep your abdomen in for 8 seconds.4. After 8 seconds, slowly lower your arm and leg.5. Then release your muscle.

name: Reach ups
description: To perform this exercise, lie on your back, arms spread over your head.Then contract your abs and lift your torso from the floor by stretching your arms towards the ceiling to "reach" as high as possible.Return slowly to the starting position by controlling the movement.Reach ups strengthen the abdominal muscles and improve the flexibility of the spine.They can be integrated into a variety of training routines to work on the strength and stability of the trunk.

description: Seated on a bench with the dumbbells on the floor bend over at 45 Degrees and then slowly raise each dumbbell to shoulder height and hold for a couple seconds before lowering to the starting position.

name: Neutral socket rowner with barbell
description: Impugnando un bilanciere con presa in pronazione (palmi rivolti verso il basso), piegare leggermente le ginocchia e portare il busto in avanti, piegando in vita, mantenendo la schiena dritta fino a portarla quasi parallela al pavimento. Suggerimento: assicurati di tenere la testa alta. Il bilanciere dovrebbe pendere direttamente davanti a te mentre le tue braccia pendono perpendicolarmente al pavimento e al busto. Questa è la tua posizione di partenza.     Ora, mantenendo fermo il busto, espira e solleva il bilanciere verso di te. Tieni i gomiti vicini al corpo e usa solo gli avambracci per sostenere il peso. Nella posizione contratta in alto, contrai i muscoli della schiena e mantieni la posizione per una breve pausa.     Quindi inspira e abbassa lentamente il bilanciere nella posizione iniziale.     Ripeti per la quantità consigliata di ripetizioni.

name: Rowing with dumbbells
description: With the dumbbells in the hand, it flexes the hip until the hands hang just below the knees (similar to the initial position of straight leg).Keep the angle of the upper body constant while contracting the dorsal muscles to carry the elbows back, pinching the shoulder blades at the top.Try not to get up in each repetition, check that the hands are below the knees in each repetition.

name: Renegade Row
description:
Get into pushup position gripping some dumbbells. Perform one pushup, then drive your left elbo up, bringing the dumbell up to your body. Return the dumbell to starting position. 
Perform another pushup and then row with the other arm to complete one rep.

description: The reverse-grip barbell curl is a variation on the biceps curl where the palms face downward. The switch from an underhand to an overhand grip brings the forearm and brachialis muscles more into the exercise.

 keep the dumbbell with about shoulder -wide grip, the arms are stretched out.Bend your arms and brig the dumbbell with a quick movement.Without a break, the weight is now brought down in a controlled manner.Note that the movement is faster than down.

name: Reverse Grip Barbell Curls
description:
Hold the barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing down) approximately shoulder-width apart. Ensure your back is straight, shoulders slightly pulled back, and arms fully extended.
Curl the barbell upwards towards your chest in a controlled motion, keeping your elbows close to your body. The motion should be smooth without any swinging or momentum use.
Once the barbell is at chest level, pause briefly to maximize contraction in the biceps and forearms.
Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position with a controlled movement, fully extending your arms.
